text: if a woman is being threatened or Harris
from the streets don't just stand by and
stay getting there intervene and try and
protect him that's the message of this
street play being performed by
university students here in Mumbai
they've titled it never forget because
it marks one year since a student was
brutally gang-raped and left to die in
India's capital Delhi the incident
shocked the nation people came out in
protests all over the country and
contains the government didn't know how
to pacify the angry crowds in March this
year India's Parliament passed a law
promising stricter punishments and
foster trials for crimes against women
the attackers of the Delhi student were
given the death sentence but what has
changed on the ground now Mumbai has
been considered one of the safest cities
in India for women but even that
perception was shattered in August this
year when a photo journalist was
gang-raped by five men virtually in the
heart of the city I suppose what has
really changed on the ground is that
safety is on people's mind more than
ever before parents are worried about
young women who are studying or working
away from their families and more women
and are taking precautionary measures
self-defence classes to try and protect
themselves from incidents like these if
they were to ever happen
